37192952.review: Very very good game, I love it, it just sucks that I broke my vive and cant play it.

36520496.review: This is basically just Solarmax 2 in VR and without a lot of the cool features Solarmax 2 has.  It's not often I'll take a 2d web based game over full VR but it plays and controls better in 2d with a mouse.  Also a few of the planet connections (pathing) are not really intuitive and you can't find out if two planets are linked until you click on them.  Solarmax 2 > Lazerbait

36498038.review: One of my favorite free games! very addictive

36182480.review: A simple concept we've all played many times before; however, VR makes it something special. Thank you for the free title- I've enjoyed it.

35957441.review: It's a fun and challenging game though requires quite a bit of micro managing on the larger maps.  This game is very similar to a game I used to play called Stellar Empires.  I'd like to see more of the features from that game added to this.  Namely the ability to have garisons on each planet to be able to build up a defense on a planet and then send extra ships on to the next planet (or planets).  Currently you only have the automatic option of sending all your ships to another planet or manually sending a percentage.  I'd also like the planets to be less symetrically in their layout.

35925680.review: Oh yes! Brilliant use of Room Scale here. Would be a little better if I didn't have to manually scale the map to my play area but the map positioning and scaling controls make are a dream to use. VR needs more roomscale strategy games like this!

35765643.review: I really wish the dev would make this into a full blown RTS game. It's executed so well and the controls are perfect.

35702365.review: one of my new favorite strategy games. so simple but so amazingly hard. Great work!

35649257.review:
First off, I would PAY MONEY for this game, esp if they added a few more ship types, game types somehow...I wish I could pin down what those things would be

Secondly, I don't say this lightly but this game has a very addictive quality and is easy enough to learn for pretty much anyone, no matter their VR experience level; but seriously this game is lacking MULTIPLAYER...






...BADLY!

35609602.review:
*** Will update recommendation if the game end ups being stable in my future attempts in the meantime here is my current insight - played a few small maps and so far so good but the concert is with medium maps and above ***

Would have recommended but unfortunately I cannot personally recommend as it stopped responding in the middle of a +2 hours session in a medium size map (at least I was starting to lose).

The game doesn't tell you it seems that you cannot start as the white team which is the first team I selected and lost a good chunk of time to try in compatibility mode etc.

Next I figured I would be better sitting after a while but cannot reorient the direction of the camera so on a larger map it is difficult to handle the troops.

Otherwise the game is pleasant so far regardless of the simple graphics as the high level of recommendations suggest.
35609602.developer_response:
First of all, thanks for trying Lazerbait! I am sorry that the game has given you a frustrating experience so far. In regards to the game being stable, I was curious if you would be willing to share your computer specs with me so that I could try and identify if there is a particular hardware compatibility issue?

I would love to help make the game a more pleasant experience if I can!

35581111.review: Lazerbait is a very simple easy to pick up game but out of all the VR games I have it is the one I am constantly coming back to. I totally missed the intro videos and went straight into game play and it was a bit odd to figure out but within a few minutes I had the controls down. It is a lot of fun and while simple it can be quite challenging. I have many more 'graphic' or 'story' intensive games and yet I am constantly coming back to this game. All in all a favorite game for me.

35564855.review: Fun strategy game, I can see this becoming big for RTS games. Add multiple ship options, different special planets upon capturing etc. Real easy to make this even better than it already is.

35497257.review: Sehr schönes Projekt. Würde dafür zwar nicht viel zahlen (wie für die meisten Ports von Handyspielen) aber ich behalte den Entwickler im Auge. Schöne Arbeit.

34361754.review: Good fun. Used to play a similar game on my phone in the early iPod Touch game.

34361598.review: It's a very impressive effort for a first-time indie developer, but I've played this game before in 2-D and I just find it very simplistic and that it doesn't lend itself too well for a VR game.

34360431.review: Suprisingly fun for how simple it is. And considering it's free...

34236835.review:
This is basically a really good clone of Galcon - a old iPhone app - for 3D in VR, I used to play that game all the time. It is very well done so I'm not complaining cause it is super great to have this game in VR. The major difference between the games is Lazerbait has the modification of your unit cap growing and shrinking based on the number of territories you have. I used to like just sitting in a game of Galcon and getting hundreds of units and eventually crashing the app so it is probably good for the sake of performance of VR that there are limits. The only thing I don't like about Lazerbait is that hard mode is pretty easy (I guess just as someone that understands how the strategy in these kinds of games works) and cheating is too hard, it would be nice if there were difficulties inbetween those.

There also seems to be some glitch that the main menu is really laggy and stutters a lot, idk why it is probably something on my end. Once you start a game it doesn't have this issue anymore so it's not a big deal.

Anyway point is it is amazing and free so I highly recommend it :)

34110983.review: Excellent gameplay, I would have been willing to pay for this.

34044283.review: Amazing Vr experience that really provides something different.

33999423.review: Standard nano rts ported for VR. Very well done, with great controls and visuals, and even leaderboards and steam achievements. All for free too! Great work dev!

33748135.review:

you must fight against multiple AI's or just 1 to conquer the entire galaxy.
Then do it again and again because it's so addicting.

32524650.review: This is a great example of a well-designed game that is simple to understand, easy to approach, yet challenging and fun to play.  It doesn't need super fancy graphics.  It's a fun, strategic game.  Great work!

32402478.review: This is a really fun game. If you like games like risk or starcraft or any sort of strategy games, this is worth trying. Even if you don't, it's probably worth trying because it's free and it works very well and is pretty fast-paced. I love this game. Thanks to the dev.

32164741.review: Free, and one of my favourites. I see myself coming back to this for a long time. I'm excited about where it can lead in the future for RTS games.

31929863.review: Honestly should have a price tag, i would easily pay $5 for this,  only played once and it will easily become one of my most played games, super simple but yet amazing. similar to multiwinia if you enjoy that, then this is a must have.   the only negatives are sometimes the controllers wont grab if your moving quickly, other than that there are no real improvements i could suggest that wouldnt involve just expanding the game! 31909004.review:
Very very good VR strategy game. 

It's free , but the dev is clearly a professional - many aspects of VR are perfectly executed (scale, visuals, interaction etc).

After year 1 of HTC Vive, it's in my top 10 games.

31740109.review: Very fun! Easy to get in to, but great depth.

31635002.review: Simple good fun. A basic concept with more depth than you'd initially think but with a few interface issues. I would love to see ship control to be a little more fluid, when the intensity of the game ramps up I find it holds me back from issuing commands quickly.

31605851.review:
This is a wonderful strategy game! I had a lot of fun changing all of the difficulties. The AI is really, really competitive at high levels. 

The mind reels at the possibilities of expansion of the game. From recording games for playback so anyone can watch them to live tournaments, this is a lot of fun for me. I really wanted to play against someone live! 

Thank you for building this. I'm sure that there are many facets of the game that have not become apparent to me, but what I Have learned so far has been very interesting. 

My only real "complaint" is that I'd like to always start where my "base planet" is near my face, because as it is, when I seect a huge map with a lot of players, it seems to put my planet at my feet and then I Just pull it up to where I can work with it. 

I look forward to playing this game much more.

31603682.review:
The gameplay is fantastic. It's very absorbing, with a very simple concept that makes full use of 3D and VR; it's a bit like Risk in space and real-time.

If you have a VR headset and you like RTS games, then I absolutely recommend you try it.

31572314.review: Remarkably engaging game. Graphics are nice and make you feel like your ended from Enders game.

31454877.review: Awsome, simple RTS. its "Little Starrs Little Wars" (android) in VR!

31442915.review: Considering the current price (free) this game is a gem. Streamlined, compelling premise of growing your control by directing your fleet of ships.

31406752.review: A strategy game in 3D, where you have to gain control over all of the planets floating in space.  Only one type of unit, numerical superiority wins, and you can only setup paths from planets that you control.  There are different world sizes, number of AI, and ship densities to play around with.  It's free - try it!

31293580.review:
Das Spiel macht wirklich Spaß! Die Schwierigkeit läßt sich problemlos individuell einstellen, sodaß immer andere Spielsitutionen und Spielumgebungen entstehen. Für mich hat dieses simple Strategiespiel, trotz einfacher Grafik, einen hohen Wiederspielwert. 

Das Spiel kann allerdings noch einiges an Finschliff vertragen. Die tutorials brechen einfach unvermittelt ab, z.b.. 
Auch wäre es cool, wenn sich die Planeten um die eigene Achse drehen würden und die Raumschiffe etwas detailierter wären. 

Das alles ändert nichts an dem tollen gameplay und die sehr guten Steuerung für zwei controller.

Die Musik könnte abwechslungsreicher sein.

I enjoy this on my phone, and i enjoy this in VR.

Graphics: 6 out of 10
Gameplay: 7 out of 10

30978663.review: a Pretty good game but bed for eyes :)

30961778.review:
The game itself is decent enough; a bit of strategy and it's nice being able to move the system of planets around to view and interact. It's paced well.

But the production values are so bad. This shouldn't be on Steam to be honest. It makes Steam look bad. It makes Unity Personal Edition look bad. All visuals are not just simple, they're shoddy. The developer putting his own voice recordings into videos of himself (or someone) playing as a means of a tutorial... it is bad. Very bad.

Kudos to the guy making this; it's a lot of work I know and you've made a neat little thing. But the production values just aren't deserving of the Steam platform at this stage.
30961778.developer_response:
It's true, the production values are pretty bad here. I have never made a game before, and honestly, working late nights and weekends on this project started to get tiresome after 6 months. I just didn't realize how much effort it would take to make all the small pieces come together (menus, options, tutorials, graphics). So I am certainly not going to try and convince you that the quality of this game is anything but poor.

However, I only ask that you take the time to notice the beauty of just one thing: the programming. There are sometimes more than 1,000 ships on the map that all need to move and interact with each other. Just calculating the orbit for 1,000 ships at 90 FPS is a cool thing, but now add in that each ship must know at all times where the closest enemy ship is such that they can shoot. Without some incredible feats of efficiency, none of this would be possible at 90 FPS.

I would never ask someone to change their honest review of a product, so please don't even consider it. I only ask that you consider in the future that the beauty of a game does not always lie in it's graphics or production quality. There may be more than meets the eye.

As always, thanks for playing Lazerbait and especially for your feedback.

30879755.review: these star wars games have aged well

30852334.review:
This game is very simple but loads of fun. The graphics aren't particularly complex, but they're very effective.
One of those easy to pick but hard to master games!
If you like space ships and RTS, you need to download this!

30803451.review:
Leading small flying arrows to their inevitable doom and conquering the planets is very fun.

A few nitpicks: the smallest map barely fits in my minimum-sized playspace, and some kind of notification for losing planets would be great.

30591295.review: Pretty fun strategy game, very unique experience!

30580070.review: This is my honest opinion. What I honestly enjoy about this game is the exercise of it. Don't get me wrong, I'm a great Galcon and StarBaron lover, but I've put on some weight in the past years and not exercised accordingly, but this game makes me want to put me hands up, left, right and behind, and I'm sweating like crazy and smiling during it. It's helping me exercise, more so than any other VR experience out there. AWESOME!!!!

30579936.review: Free and allready took 2 hours of my time. so its good

30501652.review: keeping track of multiple fronts in 3D is incredible. The ship to planet transfer mechanism creates interesting psudo choke points that are critical to winning a match. Keeping all the ships moving in the air and preventing pooling of ships is an amazing feeling. Also made my arms want to fall off... :-)

30483700.review: This game is interesting, engaging, intuitive, and fun. Highly recommended.

30475667.review: This is a great game. Highly recommend. Simple concept and great mechanics. The game is not too challenging until you get to the larger maps.

30460820.review: This fun and fast paced bite sized RTS does not have a ton of content but shows the promising future of RTS VR.

30374270.review: So simple. So great. So much fun.

30373543.review: If you just got a virtual reality headset pick this game up, this game is a lot of fun to jump into VR and experience but will only offer you a hour or two of entertainment.

30349495.review:
This game is like a 3D VR version of that flash/mobile game called Galcon. I LOVE THIS GAME.

I played for several hours in the large map with many other AI players. It's very challenging and fun to reinforce your territory.

I'd like to be able to use both hands to do the connection, the left hand isn't really very useful for anything because I don't often care about the bigger picture and I set the gameplay size once. If you are looking for ideas, it could be interesting to 'upgrade' nodes, or maybe put some sort of defense satellites around the little planets. I don't know if there's a way to fix this, but I found it frustrating to have to click on a planet before knowing the radius and available adjacent nodes. I'd like to be able to always see the light grey network connectors so I know without clicking which nodes are connected. I understand there are some which are one-way, but maybe those can have a different look I don't know maybe another arrow type.

30310509.review:
Same formula as the 2D versions of the game (Galcon Fusion, flash games) but being in VR adds a lot to the gameplay. I find myself (in a good way) losing track of my systems on large maps and I return to look at them taken over by a hostile AI and frantically reroute my forces.

Controls are excellent, quick to reroute units and set percentages.

30250361.review:
really solid 'war of the worlds' simple planetary expansion game.

+good onboarding videos, really nice to see the gameplay explained with gameplay
+solid strategy and easy to understand.. often a hard balance to hit, kudos
+good use of the ‘included’ vive controller buttons to maximize engagement, grip is so often ignored.

-I Would LOVE to see online multiplayer... would greatly increase the replayability.

30151825.review:
Very cool RTS game for VR. The game is simple. You can manage a simple space war in VR. Select planets, choose % of ships and move them to other planets to conquer a huge solar system.

CONS: After playing few games, this can be repetitive. Maybe adding more complexity like multiple type of ships, planets with moons, types of planets (earth like, gaz, etc.) could improve this game and add other challenges.

30151170.review: Tolle Umsetzung einer bekannten Idee. Ähnliche Spiele habe ich schon auf dem Smartphone gespielt. Allerdings macht es sehr viel spaß, das in VR zu spielen.

30090382.review: I have about 80 games for the vive and I think the one may just be my favorite. It is one of the coolest strategy games I have ever played. Can't get enough of it. I hope the developers continue to work on it, what a wonderful game.

30048002.review: This is straight out of Ender's Game. Really fun and well made.

30047289.review:
This game actually makes me feel like I'm commanding a battle... like in Ender's Game, where you're disconnected from the action but commanding from within a virtualized environment.  This is hands down the most playable VR game I've found.  The gameplay is great, the controls make sense, the strategy is engaging.  

NOW I WANT online multiplayer.   ALSO, I really want to be able to be able to rotate the view when I pinch the controlers to resize.  Instead of just resizing, let me rotate the entire battlefield around/upside down so that it feels more 3D.

30032267.review: Excellent simple execution of RTS. And it's free! What's not to like? Go get it! Now! :)

29970346.review: This is just what I needed. A basic strategy game where party goers could play without much explanation.

29954909.review: One of the best games at any price for VR, if you don't have it yet, what are you waiting for?  If you like strategy games, this is pretty much risk, it's brilliant!  Would have paid $15 for this if I had known how much fun it is, great job dev!  Make a bigger, more complex multiplayer version, or maybe a more grand straegy-esque version and I would pay a good deal for it!

29915906.review: Just a super great game. Simple, addictive and challenging. Congratulation to the programmer. You've made a jewel...

29866411.review:
A tech demo for the real time strategy concept that will eventually devour us all into its wargame-like maw. It's a perfect Ender's Game-esque experience for the steep price of whatever your horrid internet provider charges for a meagre amount of data.

I'm not sure why I can't stop playing this or stop cursing at the AI when it's just a simple VR tactics game, but now my arms ache and the headset is slowly melding into my pores.

Send help.

Preferably in the form of a larger spaceship with more lazers.

29850990.review: 非常棒的策略游戏！尤其是在VR中体验时的无与伦比的战场全局感，使得要获得胜利就必须同时关注整体和细节。想要赢下Cheating Mode就必须不间断地进行操作，尽可能地多线操作以获取最大限度地分流并占领对手后方没有防守的星球。有时候尽管自己处于极度不利地位，也并不意味着会输，即使自己只剩下一个星球三艘飞船也仍有可能反败为胜。要想摆脱和对手无限地交换争夺星球，就必须对星球间的路径足够了解，并在关键节点上预先布置兵力。在同对手决战时，除了保证拥有足够兵力之外，还要预留后勤补给的通道，让后续兵力源源不断。同时还不能完全沉浸在决战中，必须分出一部分兵力在争夺其它星球或者防守上。总之，这是一款简单但很有魅力的策略游戏，让你在战略上得到尽情的发挥。

29837909.review: Brilliant little game. Simple yet clever, smooth and addictive.

29751695.review: Be warned : I spent over 4 hours in a row on my first try.

29681995.review: One of my favorites. You easily get hooked.

29658953.review: Es un gran juego de estrategia. Es gratis. Va fluido en mi gtx 960. ¿Todavía no lo has probado?

29634822.review:
This is one of the most fun free VR experience that is out there!!
It has tons of replayability and it is easy to understand, definitely worth a try!!

29610626.review: I've only just tried this game, but I love it! Simple yet very entertaining: easy controls, easy to understand how the game is played and quite intriguing. Best of all: it's free! Must have for VR enthousiasts, especially if you like space/strategy games!

29568350.review:
Amazing Game! Fun and challenging.
After playing this game I would happily pay for it!
My new go to.
I wish this game got more attention.

29558666.review: I'm glad that you've seen how easily strategy games can be ported to VR... well, easy for geniuses like you, this is amazing stuff. I'm hoping this is the start of bringing Armchair-Generalness to masses... but if not, thanks for sharing with your fellow Space Cadets o7

29511291.review: I don't usually leave Steam reviews, but this game was so good I just had to. It was one of the first games I installed when I got my Vive a month ago but it sat I played because I assumed because of its simplicity I would just dismiss it in 5 minutes...how wrong I was. Massively entertaining, a brilliant idea and perfectly executed. I can't wait to play more... oh, and IT'S FREE!

29456096.review: This is a great little game that really showcases how VR RTS space conquest games might function.  It's simplistic - everyone is the same "race" and there is only one type of ship.  The only variety is it seems like some planets can jump to others but not vice versa, but this may be a bug mascarading as a feature, I dunno.  With some fleshing out this could go from an awsome tech demo game (that has pleanty of replayability!) to a genre defining game.  I really hope the dev puts out a good expansion pack for a few bucks, I would be more than happy to send some $$$ his way for his efforts.

29440313.review:
This is a simplistic strategy game similar to Eufloria, and highly reminiscent of command school in Ender's Game. The game is an excellent demonstration of the timelessness of simple strategy games like chess and, to a lesser extent, checkers: very easy to pick up, but endlessly different possibilities that keep you coming back for more.

Highly recommended for at least a quick try as this is an independently developed game offered for free. While adding extra features might betray the minimalist approach, it could be worth a shot to add an extra twist to the experience. If multiplayer is released, this will undoubtedly be a must-have for quick 10 minute strategy battles on the Vive.

29431659.review: This is the first game for the Vive that I feel like I CAN'T get tired of!  Lazerbait is a great example a game that's immensely fun to play despite the fact that it uses simple graphics and simple game play.  The first game I played on easy difficulty and small map, I thought "eh, not much to this game at all, I'll get bored fast".  After working my way up to 7 AI opponents on a large map with higher AI difficulties, the game became a riot.  The fact that this game works fine as a "sitting" game, is all the better also.  Highly recommended for anybody looking for a light to medium, fast paced strategy game.

29421815.review:
Thank you for this great free game.
Gameplay is really good.
it only misses a campaign, but it's free !
I will look forward for ypur next games

29401482.review:
Lazerbait, a pretty well made RTS that requires planning and quick responding.

Pros:
- Free (no harm done in trying, right?)
- Unique-ish gameplay. It's territory control
- Not too performance demanding (it runs on the Unity engine)
- Controller skin support (not that important, but why not)
- Easy to learn
- Supports Oculus Touch and HTC Vive
- Can be played room-scale and standing/seated

Cons:
- No multiplayer support
- Games can become very difficult if you have more than 3 of AI players
- (Nitpicking) Ship models are a bit too generic (but minimalist, which is okay)
- (Nitpicking) Planets all have the same texture

Overall, I found this game to be very fun, and I would definitely recommened it to any HTC Vive or Oculus Touch owner.

29390216.review: this is a cool game.. very editive.

29381821.review:
In my opinion, for VR this is one of the best free -actual-  action games on steam right now.

While the gameplay is very simplistic, it's a challenge and workout to win. I don't see myself coming back to this game often, but for free, it is worth a play-through.

29292122.review: Ever see the Star Trek episode where Data stalemates a person in a strategy game? I felt like that human, and it was awesome. Honestly, I feel like I'm in Ender's Game, constantly regrouping and directing my forces at the ever expanding AI opponents. It's a fun game that tests your ability to multitask and attacking the enemy on multiple fronts. Hope it someday becomes multiplayer because figthing a friend sounds fun as hell, but until then, the AI is plenty challenge enough and entertaining.

29283427.review: If you got Vive you have to try it. wish there was a multiplayer mode.

29273983.review: I love this game! I'd like to suggest adding an online multiplayer function. I think that would make it so awesome.

29151070.review: retro and totally innovating... well done team!!!!!

29105310.review: Pretty much the same solid concept you've seen a million times on your mobile phone but this time in vr. But it feels great. Absolutley recommend picking it up. Could easily be priced a few bucks if you compare it to the mass of overpriced titles on the market right now.

29101630.review: C'est bien LE jeu à testé sur HTC vive si vous aimez les jeux de conquêtes en 3D en temps réel :)

29077691.review: Poking planets for hours is surprisingly fun

29047546.review:
5/5 - Value - price to hours spent ($0.00/10 hours)
2/5 - First Time to VR - The spectacle of being in an Enders Game like environment is awesome, but the controls are tutorialed to new players via a youtube video. With a proper tutorial, the excellent controls could lead to a better experience for first timers.
5/5 - Controls and Immersion - Simply spectacular. Feels natural and amazing - only complaint is, again, there is no tutorial.
5/5 - Person Score - I don't really play it anymore, but this is an excellent game that I *still* think of fondly. I'll pick it up again every once in a while, and it doesn't get much better than free.

As it is, it is a perfect package, with perfect controls. If the creator was to make an advanced version with more content and with a price tag, I would be all over that in a heart-beat. Truly amazing - like Ender's Game!

29027409.review:
日本語はサポートされていませんが、プレイしていけばなんとなく分かります。
星取りゲームで、相手の星を全て奪えば勝ち、自分の星を全て奪われたら負けです。
取った星が多ければ多いほど、自機数の上限が上がっていき、自動的に生産されます。
星が大きければ大きいほど遠くの星に移動できます。
単純だけどもかなり面白いと思いました。

無料なので是非！（2017/01/05）

This is your next addiction! It's so simple, yet so damn fun! I would recommend starting on easy and figuring out what you're doing before stepping up the challenge. It didn't take long before I figured it out and I thought for sure by then I was going to lose the game... well, I managaed to create a strategy to come back and eventually beat the computer (yes, on easy...).

This is a good choice for introducing non-gamers to a simple and fun game in VR.

28762577.review: This is an awesome game -- have been waiting for good non-"First Person walkaround" game. This has some really fun game elements. This is going to help define this kind of game genre.

28730623.review: This is one of the best free VR game for Vive. It's got the same game mechanics as Galcon Fusion and Eufloria, so if you like those games you're gonna love this. 28581126.review: I'm still new to the Vive but this has become one of my go-to games for when I just want to jump in to something without a lot of fuss.  The gameplay is deceptively easy at first but gets hard quickly once you increase the number of opponents and their speed/intelligence.  It'll have you moving around your entire play space.  I highly recommend this.

28532639.review: VR should have MORE of these types of game...  This type of interface is awesome.  A simple strategy game that you can spend hours in as opposed to an FPS that you get tired of in 20 minutes.  I'd LOVE to see them keep going down this path with these types of games.  Yes, the graphics appear a little simplistic and there's room for a little visual polish, but I'll enjoy this more than any other game I've found so far for the Vive.

28512025.review: Отличная стратегия, всем советую. Из минусов только отсутствие мультиплеера

28476821.review:
Since I'm a longtime fan of Eufloria, a comparison is inevitable. 
The gameplay and controls are spot on, it's basically Eufloria in VR, and just as good as I hoped it to be. Excellent work here! The game is obviously a one man show, the graphics are functional but simplistic, however the style does work though I would have loved more close-up details on the ships. It desperately needs a campaign mode though, while I can definitely see myself tackling more and harder opponents just for the fun of it a proper campaign would make it last longer for me for sure. Also, I would love to see the developer's own take on Eufloria's added complexity with planet upgrades, different ship types etc.

So there it is: 

Gameplay and controls are pure gold, but the game screams for a campaign mode increasing complexity as you go, and the visuals leave some things to be desired. In general it seems like an embryo waiting to grow into something awesome. Which I would happily pay good money for.

28467366.review:

A simple, enjoyable game.  
The maximum number of ships you can control is based upon the number (and size) of planets under your control.  Conquer more planets, amass more ships.  Rinse, repeat.

27772754.review: OK, so maybe I'm a bit obsessed; but I love the hell out of this game!  A game that is fun and easy enough to learn, and then frustrating and nearly impossible to master is probably the goal of any strategy game... Lazerbait nailed it.  But then to hear the story behind the game, how it was this, like, a DIY experiment... I am blown away and inspired.  I hope the next game from T.S. is not free, so I can pay for it twice.  If there's more dev's to thank... they should have included credits in the game.  I beg of you to include your fans suggestions (multiplayer, bug fixes and maybe a story?) in the sequal... as this game for free is a steal.  Again, thank you... this game rules.

26724508.review:
Core i5 2500k, GTX 970, 16GB DDR3, HTC Vive

Runs smoothly on my hardware.

This is a clever RTS.  Your main resource are planets.  The more planets you control, the more ships you can have.  I don't know if multiplayer is currently supported, or if it is in the works, but this is a fun little game.

For more replayability, I'd love to see a custom map builder so players can create their own battlefields.

26687240.review: This free game is better than most paid games on the vive. Its a simple strategy game that has been done before, but the performance in vr is incredible.

26652386.review:
Excellent implementation in Vive. A near perfect adaption of the basic strategy fundamentals into VR. The AI can offer significant challenge which is refreshing, build your empire then watch it collapse 5 minutes later, then another 5 minutes later and you've regrouped and are counter attacking. Unique and free, just play it already.

Suggestions for further development :

Option of AI 'races' with unique stats like more powerful but slower ships, faster ship build times but less powerful etc.

Set senarios being selectable - e.g. 'Rebels' where an existing vast empire exists and you start with a couple of planets. However your ships build faster (due to public sympathy) giving you a chance. Or 'Bridge' where one planet serves as a gateway between opposing sides. Etc etc.

Save-able games for large campaigns!

Perhaps options to build different things on planets.

Very well executed too - multiple ways to make the game easier/harder, longer/shorted and it's easy to re-size the game world and move it about so you should be able to play whatever the size of your play space.

Fantastic yet simplistic little space RTS. No reason not to try it for free.

I really enjoyed the user interface and concept. Lots of options to make things more or less difficult/complex.

It gets a little dull after a short while however, as there are currently no real goals, and it's essentially just a game of Risk in outer space.

If the Devs gave the game a story mode and/or multiplayer, and a bit of a graphical update, it could be incredibly fun and I'd certainly be happy to pay money for it.

This is a fantastic game, I can't believe I didn't see it before today.

I haven't played for long but I can see myself going back to this and trying different combinations of players and difficulties. I really hope it's the something that might get updated or even add in multiplayer. 

The movement of the game area is smooth and felt so natural when needing to travel across the map.

I dig the simple art style and I for one hope that's not part of the game that will change in the future.

Thus far Lazerbait is the first RTS for VR I've played, and through it may be very elementary in graphical quality, it certainly makes up for it in the immersive feeling you get when as you stand in the middle of a virtural solar system and displace and position your virtural ships to conquer the system.

With a variety of difficulties and other toggles for ship count, graphical quality, map size, team colour, ect; it can be as easy or challenging as you wish. Certainly a very welcome experimentation of this game genre in VR, I do say it works well!

26361284.review:
Strategie in 3D, super.
Sehr einfaches Konzept, aber macht lust auf mehr solcher spiele.
Spielprinzip: Mit den eigenen Schiffen müssen andere Planeten erobert werden, je mehr planeten im Eienbesitz sind, desto mehr Schiffe besitz man. Ziel ist es, alle Planeten einer Karte zu besitzen.
Mit dem 2ten Controller kann die Karte verschoben werden und mit dem ersten Controller kann die Flotte Befehligt werden.

Auf Easy und mit 1 NPC Gegner ist das Spiel schnell durch, aber mit mehreren Gegnern und größere Karte etwas Anspruchsvoller.
Wenn dann noch die KI höher geschraubt wird, dann wirds intressant und schnell.

Für Freunde der strategiespiele zu empfehlen.

Sweat drips down off my face after hours of galaxy-crushing tug-of-war. First there were eight, now it's down to two. Two species left fighting for galactic dominance. 

Red is strong, but I'm faster, stronger. I sweep up behind his lines on 3 fronts and conquer his ill-defended worlds. I can taste my imminent victory.

I connect all my people in one vast web ever pushing forward. At last I draw the last command and watch the ships of my people fly foward. Farewell Red. Farewell.

26084390.review:
Brutal!!!

El concepto és muy sencillo, cada planeta genera naves a una ratio determinada y las puede enviar a un rango que depende del tamaño del planeta.  El objetivo, eliminar a todos los oponentes.  Simple no?

Pues te vas a sentir como Ender controlando flotas y gestionando las rutas de refuerzos.  Si escoges nivel medio en todo (mapa, IA, nº de jugadores) te vas a encontrar gestionando desenfrenadamente todas tus tropas, intentando arrinconar el enemigo y no dejar rutas abiertas por las que se pueda colar y arruinarte la ofensiva...

Encima gratuito.  De verdad que no se puede pedir mas!

26081744.review: Fans of realtime strategy, this is a must have!  The game is simple yet highly addictive.  After getting tired of all the FPS and some novelty games, this one truely got my full attention everytime I pick up the goggles.  Excellent job!

26079628.review: Really fun, easy to pick up strategy game. It can get crazy depending on how you set up the game, but it's still fun to drop to easy mode and send a massive swarm around a map.

26079048.review:
First off, it's a free game so If you're curious you should try it out.  
Secondly, it's a decent game (though not very big on visuals)
Lastly the author has mentioned opening up the source so that others can use this as a base game for future mods so it'll be worth seeing what happens in the future with this game.

So ok, enough of that.  What is this game?  
It's a strategy game sorta like the board game RISK set in space (without the dice rolls and without having to choose your countries first). Actually it's more like an RTS, but the way you advance in the game is by sending your ships to take over the nearby planets.

So yeah, You start out with a few ships on a planet and it slowly increases the number of ships you have over time. You have a number of neighboring planets that are either netural (white) or an enemy (some other color).  So you can tell your ships to fly from your home planet to the adjacent planet, destroy the enemy ships there, and after you have the majority of the ships in orbit around a planet, a 3 second countdown starts before the planet changes to your color. 

Now you can make ships on two planets, and spread out from there.  Like RISK, you can attack with varying amounts of your forces with the risk of spreading yourself too thin and leaving it open for your enemy to come in and wipe you out quickly.  Alternately you can send a small amount of forces over to ensure the planet you just left is well defended, but if you go too slow, your enemy will have many more planets and ships with which to attack you.

You have to strike a balance between attacking quickly and making sure you're well defended against attacks.  You can also form a chain of planets so that as new ships are built they are automatically sent to the front lines (or sent on to attack).  I think the game has a limit on how many planets can be chained together at any one time though.

The Graphics are simple (a sphere representing a planet of varying sizes and small polygons for your fighters) but it's done well enough to get the point across.  Maybe one day someone will come in and add to the graphics to make it look nicer but it's hardly necessary, and with a lot of ships on screen it might just slow the whole game down.

There's a variety of game options for difficulty: (Easy, Normal, Hard, and Cheating AI) as well as other options that can affect the difficulty (more enemy players, more planets to capture, and faster moving ships which speeds the whole game up).  As a beginner I found the default easy level game to be pretty easy without being too simple.  Just the act of speeding up the ships made the game more challenging instantly, and if I had tossed in another AI it might have felt like hard mode right away...I don't know how much the AI would fight amongst itself.

There are also leaderboards for how many times you've beaten the game on each difficulty, as well as how many enemy ships you've destroyed.  Not so much a matter of skill as it is a matter of how much time you invested on the game to get there....still it's neat to see.

Things I liked about the game:
[list]
   [*] Well, it's free! You immediately lower your expectations when the game doesn't cost you a dime to try out.
   [*] As a strategy game, it's simple enough to pick up quickly while challenging enough to give you a reason to play after you know what you're doing.
   [*] You can resize the playing area by using the grip buttons on the vive controllers. Zoom in or out
   [*] You can still walk around the area and manually select your next target rather than teleporting everywhere.
[/list]

Things I didn't like:
[list]
   [*]The graphics are a bit too simple
   [*] Some cool battle music would be nice but I did not remember any really good music.  
   [*] I think even with resizing the play area, I eventually wound up close to a wall (where the tracking is the worst)   I don't think there's ANY kind of teleportation mechanic in the game. Even a button to "recenter the play area" would be nice.
[/list]

There's really not much bad I can say about the game, and I think it has a lot of potential.  Sadly, this free game is worth more to me than some of the "cheap as free" games I've bought in the past (either in a bundle or on sale for 90% off).  It's a fun little strategy game. Check it out.

26058725.review:
Interplanetary Risk with a side of shepherding.  And lasers.

The game is simple to pick up, you can play one-handed if you like, but as you play you'll learn how to swarm your ships tactically - when to send the entire fleet and when to break off a small force for attack or defense.  You can also set continual pathways so newly spawned ships will move themselves to the battle's front or even circle between planetary systems in a patrol pattern.

Rather than gather resources, ships are automatically placed into orbit around planets and moons you control with each territory adding to your fleet maximum.   Of course, this works both ways and so losing a swath of territory will leave you or your enemies unable to produce fresh ships.  This can quickly turn the tide of a game if one side manages to get a swarm behind enemy lines where worlds tend to be relatively undefended.

Just give it a go if you like simple strategy games you will love this.

26040198.review:
Amazing game. If you don't try it because you think it will be a cheap VR experiment like so many other free games, you're doing yourself a disservice. I didn't think there was a way to do strategy in a way that was actually better in VR, but this guy (gal?) has done it. 

For those who played mushroom wars, it's a similar concept, not as fleshed out yet, but in 3 dimensions with really excellent controls. I'd love to see it get more of that depth (different abilities, capture points, racial passives, etc) but I understand you can't expect updates like that out of a free game. Like Cosmic Trip, this is a concept that could one day expand into one of the Vive killer apps.

26039247.review:
This is a great VR game. Do not let its simple looking gameplay fool you, this is a lot of fun and rather strategic when playing on the larger maps. You can customize every aspect of the battle, from map size to unit count to the number of players. 

Another neat thing is that you can zoom in and out to adjust the scale of things. You can have the enitre battle on a chess board, or get real close to a planet and watch ships the size of trucks fly by. It is super cool.

I would entirely recomend this game.

26038571.review:
Me and 5 AI's, battling to the death. I killed three early on as in all FFAs, then had to deal with the winner of the top of the map, Blue. Suspecting my fleet was a bit smaller, I avoided his main fleet and sent mine on a suicide mission taking planet after planet deeper into Blue's territory, as quick as I could. Blue had no defence behind his lines, so I split my force 4 ways and took over much of his home turf. Proud of myself, I looked down to see he'd done the same to me! My reinforcing lines were cut and in disarray. 

Re-grouping my split forces, I turned around and battled back the other way. On it went, eventually I was able to muster a decent enough fleet to clash with blue's death-ball head on, as I battled back down to where I started. Did I have enough? If I lost the battle I'd be cooked. It was quite exciting sending the order for my hard-won fleet to attack the planet blue's fleet was circling. The ships clashed, and my fleet rolled over blue like a tidal wave - Lazerbait! Great fun!

The first thought you have about this game is 'wouldn't it be nice to make a fortress out of a planet' - and yes, it would, all that sort of thing. But that would slow the game down, this isn't StarCraft. It's a fast-paced game of strategic positioning. There are only a few mechanics (territory, reinforcement, splitting) and they are used masterfully to create limitless possibilities. Less is more, this game is fantastic. 

This is a really great game. Play it.

26036285.review: This is a really, really fun game. Huge map on hard had me battling for over an hour. pls add multiplayer

26035099.review: This is my first recention of a game. I was pleasantly surprised that it's free and really good. Good fluency in the game (however, a 1080 GTX), intuitive and easy to understand. Easy to recommend this game to others.
